description: '''West Coast hip-hop''' is a regional genre of [[Hip-hop|hip-hop music]] that encompasses any artists or music that originated in the [[West Coast of the United States]]. West Coast hip-hop began to dominate from a radio play and sales standpoint during the early to-mid 1990s with the birth of [[G-funk]] and the emergence of [[record label]]s such as [[Suge Knight]] and [[Dr. Dre]]'s [[Death Row Records]], [[Ice Cube]]'s [[Lench Mob Records]], the continued success of [[Eazy-E]]'s [[Ruthless Records]], Dr. Dre's [[Aftermath Entertainment]], and many others. Though the term "West Coast hip hop" may also be used to describe [[Hip-hop in the Pacific Northwest|Northwest hip-hop]] and other movements from the Western U.S., it is primarily associated with the state of [[California]], especially [[Los Angeles]] and the [[San Francisco Bay Area]].
